job_description: ['TRANSFR, a leader in the virtual reality educational and training software industry, is currently seeking a full-time Build / DevOps Engineer who can help ensure that we continuously improve our CI/CD pipeline and make sure that we are helping the development teams get their work in the hands of QA.', 'The role requires the ability to understand and communicate feedback between all the parties involved in the simulation process. The ideal candidate will have experience leading cross-teams, collaborative projects and the ability to solve, identify and work through complex problems; a true love for learning; and a burning desire to contribute to outcomes that change the world.', '', 'Responsibilities', 'Maintenance and improvement of the build system', 'Developing and managing Continuous Integration systems.', 'Code compilation and integration.', 'Improving builds performance.', 'Working closely with the development team to integrate new deployment processes.', 'Coordinating offline automation processes.', 'Maintaining source control branches and performing integrations with merge conflicts.', 'Providing Git support for the teams.', 'Creating and maintaining documentation of the build/release process.', 'Create and setting up new servers/services to support the growing operations', 'Maintain and optimize our Technical Operations', 'Provide monitoring to our services and work on playbook and escalation plans.', 'Qualifications', 'Unity experience', '5+ experience in software development and DevOps', 'Experience with C#', 'DevOps Tools, including Terraform, Ansible, Kubernetes, Jenkins, Docker', 'Experience with databases, NoSQL and SQL, such as MongoDB and Postgresql', 'Demonstrable scripting experience with a variety of scripting languages for automating tasks, generating reports, and creating tools (e.g. Groovy, Python, Shell)', 'Experience using source control software (e.g. Perforce, GIT)', 'Experience working in a cloud environment such as GCP, AWS or Azure', 'Experience using CI tooling', 'Experience using Jira', 'A proactive attitude towards helping others to get their work done faster and more efficiently.', 'Interest in good code practices.', 'Strong attention to detail', 'We are an agile environment, so kanban or scrum experience is a plus', 'What We Offer:', 'The base salary range for this position is expected to be between $144K - $158K CAD, with the actual base salary amount dependent on a number of factors, including but not limited to a candidate’s credentials, relevant experience, and primary job location. In addition to salary this role will be eligible for additional company benefits such as stock options, 401(k), paid vacation and sick time, and medical/dental/vision insurance.', 'We invite you to be a part of something BIG. join us. Create alternative pathways to prosperity by helping to develop training simulations to teach skills that lead to well-paying jobs.', 'Must be legally eligible to work in Canada without restriction.', 'TRANSFR is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to diversity and inclusion in the workplace. We prohibit discrimination and harassment of any kind based on race, color, sex, religion, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, genetic information, pregnancy, or any other protected characteristic as outlined by federal or state laws.']

Additional years of experience in lieu of a degree may be accepted on select contracts.', 'Skills & Experience:', 'Experience using the Linux CLI', 'Experience developing and maintaining scripts using Bash/Python', 'Experience installing, configuring, and supporting COTS/GOTS/FOSS software, libraries, and packages in a Linux environment', 'Experience with containerization technologies such as Docker and containerd', 'Experience with NoSQL technologies such as MongoDB, Elasticsearch, and Accumulo', 'Experience with container orchestration technologies such as Kubernetes', 'Experience administering Kubernetes clusters on bare metal in a Linux environment', 'Experience with IaC (Infrastructure as Code) concepts, principles and automation tools such as Ansible and Terraform', 'Experience with CI/CD principles, methodologies, and tools such as GitLab CI', 'Desired:', 'Familiarity with Site Reliability Engineering (SRE) principles and applications', 'Experience with Linux cluster/node monitoring tools', 'Experience with the Atlassian Tool Suite (JIRA, Confluence)', 'Experience with Git Version Control System', 'To apply, please visit www.arteratech.com or email your resume to staffing@arteratech.com.', 'Artera Technologies provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national origin, marital status, age and/or disability.', '', 'n7hlWTETMF']

job_description: ['Visual Soft, Inc is seeking qualified candidates (US Citizens with active', 'ACTIVE TOP SECRET', 'clearance - a requirement on its sub contract with work share on a Project with a Major Prime) for the following position for a federal agency.', '', '', 'Job Title', ': DevOps Engineer - an', 'Active Top SECRET required', '', 'Compensation', ': Negotiable with standard benefits based on experience, education, degree and certifications', '', 'Location', ': Crystal City, Arlington, VA (on a federal agency project)', '', 'Job Description', ':', 'Requirements:', '', '8 years of experience developing comprehensive and innovative technical solutions with at least 1 year experience with 1 of the 3 major cloud service providers (Amazon, Microsoft, or Google).', '', 'Experience architecting and migrating on-premises applications into a cloud platform.', '', 'Associate level certification is a substitute for 2 years’ experience.', '', 'Our standard benefits', ": include 3 weeks of Paid time off (PTO that includes sick leave). Any unused PTO will be issued as a check at the end of an employee's anniversary with us. we also provide 2 floating and 8 public holidays. Floating and holidays expire at the end of every year of service of an employee. In addition, company will cover 50% of health and dental insurances only for all full time employees, however, dependents can be added at extra cost. Employee's health and dental coverage becomes effective after 30 days or first of the month after an employee completes initial 30 working days, we cover 50% for the employee's health and dental insurances. An employee has to finish all of your paper work for health and dental in the first 30 days of your employment with us. We provide STD, LTD and one time salary equivalent of life insurance at NO cost to all full time employees. All full time employees or w-2 employees with no benefits will be eligible to participate in company's 401k program after 90 days of employment with a company match of 4%, immediate vesting. In addition, all w-2 employees are eligible to be part of company's profit sharing, no employee contributions required.", 'NO commuting and/or parking expenses are provided to work within DC metro area locations.']

job_description: ['About DECA Games', '', 'We believe that games should be played for decades but many are abandoned even when a loyal community is screaming to keep them alive.', 'DECA', 'specializes in acquiring games from other developers and reinvigorating them to continue to entertain for decades. When other studios see an old game, we see a fantastic set of problems to solve and a huge opportunity.', '', 'DECA', 'is a remote company with over 300 people in over 30 countries globally.', 'DECA', 'is also a part of the Embracer Group, the largest public gaming company in Europe.', '', 'About our culture', '', "We've managed to maintain a small company feel with the stability and resources of a much larger one. We fully believe in the flexibility of a remote workplace. Team members are trusted to manage their time and get things done independently. We think that egos and politics need to be checked at the virtual door. That means no jerks are allowed, that no job is too small for anyone, and an openness to help and learn from each other is required. We love the challenge of working within constraints and love when we succeed as a team. Check out more about us and our values on our website (www.decagames.com (http://www.decagames.com)).", '', 'This is a', 'remote', 'position. You can work from anywhere in the world in the CET timezone (9 a.m. - 6 p.m. CET).', '', 'About the role', '', 'We are looking for a passionate and talented', 'Senior DevOps Engineer', "to join our growing, centralized DevOps team and play an integral role in migrating various mobile, console, and desktop games into DECA's portfolio, building and maintaining diverse CI/CD pipelines, cloud infrastructures, and tools.", '', 'Responsibilities', '', 'Participate in migrating legacy applications and infrastructures onto modern rails and technologies.', 'Improve monitoring and logging.', "Document the project's white spots, troubleshoot emerging issues, and write post-mortems.", 'Assist the development and BI teams in their tasks.', '', 'Requirements', '', 'Must-Have:', '', 'Extensive experience with public clouds (AWS, GCP, Azure).', 'Extensive experience with IaC methodology and tools (Terraform, Terragrunt, Pulumi).', 'Extensive scripting language experience (Shell, Python, Ruby).', 'Extensive version control systems experience (Git, SVN, Perforce).', 'Extensive experience in CI/CD practices and tools (Jenkins, GHA, Gitlab).', 'Extensive Linux administration experience.', 'Extensive experience with networking, firewalls, secrets, and cloud security.', 'Experience with configuration management tools (Chef, Ansible, Salt).', 'Experience with monitoring solutions (Datadog, Prometheus).', 'Experience with logging solutions (Splunk, Fluentd, ELK).', 'Strong problem-solving/debugging skills.', 'Strong documentation/presentation/communication skills.', 'Ability to assist others in their work.', 'Ability to work unsupervised.', '', 'Nice to Have:', '', 'Strong software engineering skills, preferably Python, or Java.', 'DBA experience with MySQL, PostgreSQL, BigQuery, and Redshift.', 'Virtualization/Docker/Containers/ECS/Kubernetes experience.', 'Serverless experience.', 'Windows Server administration skills.', 'Bare-metal server maintenance experience.', 'Experience in shipping mobile apps.', 'Cost-saving experience.', '', 'Benefits', '', 'Remote first company culture.', 'Flexible work hours to support a personal work-life balance.', 'Weekly remote Embodiment@Work breathing and workout exercises.', 'Online language classes: English, German, French, Spanish, etc.', 'Working in a multicultural environment with people from over 30 different countries.', 'Flat hierarchies with an open-door policy.']

job_description: ['Overview:', 'Wipro Limited (NYSE: WIT, BSE: 507685, NSE: WIPRO) is a leading technology services and consulting company focused on building innovative solutions that address clients’ most complex digital transformation needs. We leverage our holistic portfolio of capabilities in consulting, design, engineering, operations, and emerging technologies to help clients realize their boldest ambitions and build future-ready, sustainable businesses. A company recognized globally for its comprehensive portfolio of services, strong commitment to sustainability and good corporate citizenship, we have over 250,000 dedicated employees serving clients across 66 countries. We deliver on the promise of helping our customers, colleagues, and communities thrive in an ever-changing world.', '', 'A PROUD HISTORY OF OVER 75 YEARS', 'FY22 REVENUE 10.4 BN USD', 'WE’RE PRESENT IN 66 COUNTRIES', 'OVER 1,400 ACTIVE GLOBAL CLIENTS', 'Role – AWS Data Engineer', 'Location – Portland, OR ( Hybrid)', 'Position Summary/Job Description:', 'Design, implement, and manage cloud infrastructure using Infrastructure as Code (IAC) principles with Terraform and CloudFormation.', 'Utilize your in-depth knowledge of AWS services to architect, develop, and optimize scalable solutions that meet business requirements.', 'Develop and maintain Java Spring Boot applications, ensuring code quality, performance, and maintainability.', 'Build and maintain CI/CD pipelines to automate application deployment, testing, and monitoring using tools such as Jenkins, GitLab CI/CD, or AWS CodePipeline.', 'Monitor, troubleshoot, and optimize cloud-based applications and services for performance, availability, and security.', 'Collaborate with DevOps and security teams to implement and enhance security best practices, compliance, and data protection.', 'Participate in cross-functional team discussions, code reviews, and technical discussions to drive innovation and continuous improvement.', 'Encourage collaborative efforts and camaraderie with on-shore and off-shore team members.', '', 'Relevant engineering experience such as software development; critical reasoning skills; ability to communicate technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders; experience delivering quality engineering outcomes.', 'Familiarity with containerization using Docker and Experience with CI/CD pipelines, automated testing, and deployment automation tools (Jenkins, GitLab CI/CD, CodePipeline, etc.)', 'Strong problem-solving and communication skills and the ability to work effectively in cross-functional teams.', 'AWS certifications (such as AWS Certified DevOps Engineer or AWS Certified Solutions Architect) are a strong plus', 'Wipro is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer and makes all employment and', "employment-related decisions without regard to a person's race, sex, national origin,", 'ancestry, disability, sexual orientation, or any other status protected by applicable law..']

job_description: ['Come join our Engineering team!', '', '', 'FutureFit AI is looking for a Senior DevOps/Cloud Engineer to join our team. We have a culture of high trust, high impact, high velocity and a gritty determination to win. If you are passionate about all things devops/cloud, like to have fun, do it right, and get things done we would love to hear from you!', 'An important note: Data shows that men on average apply for a role if they meet 3/10 requirements while women often only do so if it’s 10/10. We work hard to be clear and specific about what our roles include and encourage you to apply if you see a strong (but not necessarily perfect) fit between you and the opportunity.', 'About You:', 'CI/CD - You can build and maintain pipelines that achieve continuous delivery with confidence and quality', 'Cloud - You have experience deploying, running and maintaining scalable and resilient applications in AWS via infrastructure as code', 'Security - You have designed and built secure cloud networks and the associated controls/processes to maintain and monitor that performance and security', 'Best Practices - You believe in and foster a culture of strong engineering principles around logging, monitoring, test automation and designing for reliability, scalability, observability and security', 'Test Automation - You are a firm believer in all levels of test automation (unit, api, UI) to support continuous delivery with confidence and quality', 'Communication - You can share your perspective clearly and constructively, you are comfortable challenging ideas and collaborating to find the best approach', 'Grit - You like to solve challenging problems, are not afraid of the unknown, eager to learn and take a systematic approach to solving problems', 'AI - You are interested in integrating advances in AI into FutureFit AI products and the development process to drive improvements in velocity, quality and engineer experience', 'Values - You are a good person who shares our values of excellence, transparency, and humanity', 'Core Requirements:', 'CI/CD - proven experience managing repositories and pipelines (GitHub Actions preferred)', 'Infrastructure as Code - proven experience with CDK, Terraform or Pulumi', 'AWS - proven experience deploying, running, maintaining, monitoring, securing, and scaling multi-tenant, web applications on AWS', 'Our Technology Stack:', 'Front End - React, TypeScript, Tailwind, Storybook', 'Back End - Node.js, Nest.js, Python, Flask, GraphQL, Elasticsearch', 'Data Stores - Postgres, Mongo, S3, Redshift', 'DevOps/Cloud - GitHub, SonarCloud, Sentry, New Relic, AWS (GuardDuty, Cognito, CloudFront, ECS, RDS, S3, SQS, Lambda, etc)', 'Location:', 'Most days we work from home but everyone comes to the office at least once a week for face to face collaboration and team building. The office is located at 325 Front St West (a short walk from Union Station).', 'Our Company:', 'In looking at a job posting, it’s often hard to get a basic picture of the company profile (size, stage, structure, etc.) which is why we are sharing it with you upfront. This helps you quickly decide and helps us focus any time we spend together on going beyond the basics:', 'Funding', ': We have raised one round of funding led by JP Morgan which fueled a significant growth trajectory for us and we have a safe financial runway to execute against.', 'Problem Domain:', 'Future of Work / Workforce Development - important that the problem domain interests you even if you haven’t worked in the space before.', 'Customers', ': We partner with workforce development agencies, government agencies, and employers/enterprises.', 'Structure', ': We are organized around the following key departments: Growth, Customer Success, Product, Engineering, Data, People & Culture, Finance & Operations.', 'Team', ': We are a team of 30-50 across US and Canada with main hubs in New York and Toronto. This role will be based in Toronto.', 'Core Principles', ': Be Curious, Drive to Outcomes, Raise the Bar, Speed Matters, Own It, Put We Over Me', 'About FutureFit AI', 'At FutureFit AI, we’re on a mission to unlock pathways between talent and opportunity using the power of AI. We focus on personalized, AI-powered career guidance for job seekers, emphasizing skills over extensive resumes, and partner with workforce development partners, governments, and employers to level access to opportunity.', "FutureFit AI is a growing, venture-backed company focused on using technology to improve the lives and outcomes for people going through career transitions. We’re a small, driven team, united by our commitment to the job seekers and workforce ecosystems we serve. We're not just building a company; we're shaping the future of work.", 'We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, perform essential job functions, and receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request an accommodation.', '', 'FutureFit AI All rights reserved, we are proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, disability, veteran status, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. We encourage people of different backgrounds, experiences, abilities, and perspectives to apply.']

job_description: ['SENIOR DEVOPS ENGINEER (Hybrid Position. Must be in office Tuesday-Thursday)', '', 'The Senior DevOps Engineer will be part of the team that is responsible for designing, developing, and operating the infrastructure and applications that make Throtle’s data onboarding solution work. The ideal candidate can work with teammates in troubleshooting problems, identifying resolutions, and assessing situations in real time. Our team is empowered to keep our fast-paced, high volume processing environment operational for our clients and partners.', '', '', 'PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES:', '', '', 'Maintaining our existing automation, infrastructure and monitoring.', '', 'Be involved in real-time assessment of issues and help develop solutions', '', 'Create solutions to manage and monitor our infrastructure and operations.', '', 'Create and maintain alerts and monitoring to detect issues before they impact business operations', '', 'Build and design solutions that mitigate risk and increase efficiencies', '', 'Automate processes and sub-processes to enable greater scale and speed', '', 'Take part in performance & capacity monitoring and planning', '', '', 'KNOWLEDGE AND SKILL REQUIREMENTS', '', '', 'Have 3+ years as part of a DevOps team in a real time operational processing environment', '', 'Significant experience with Ansible or comparable configuration management software such as Puppet, Chef, etc.', '', 'Experience operating within AWS', '', 'Hands-on experience with firewall management and network security', '', 'Experience as a Linux SysAdmin', '', 'Working knowledge of networking: TCP/IP, ICMP, SSH, LDAP, DNS', '', 'Have proficiency in multiple coding/scripting languages such as Python, Bash, SQL.', '', 'Ability to identify problems, and effectively communicate solutions to peers and management', '', 'OTHER VALUABLE SKILLS', '', '', 'Experience with data flow and queue management using tools like Kafka and Flume', '', 'Experience with Prometheus or other cloud-native monitoring solutions', '', 'Experience with the ELK stack', '', 'Working knowledge of storage systems and formats', '', 'Experience with a RDBMS – PostgreSQL, Oracle, or Microsoft SQL Server.', '', 'Exposure to NoSQL/Big Data: Hadoop, HBase, Cassandra, MongoDB', '', '', 'About Throtle:', '', 'Throtle is a leading identity company trusted by the world’s top brands and agencies located in Red Bank, NJ. At Throtle, we empower brands at scale with true individual-based marketing using a data-centric identity and onboarding approach.', '', 'Throtle is a company that truly values its employees and their work-life balance. We offer a comprehensive, competitive, and inclusive set of health, financial and other benefits that support your total well-being:', '', '', 'Competitive compensation.', '', 'Comprehensive benefits which include:', '', 'Medical, Dental, and Vision', '', 'Life insurance.', '', 'Long-Term Disabilit', '', 'A generous PTO program.', '', 'A 401k plan supported by a company match.', '', 'Half Day Summer Fridays (close at 1 p.m. Memorial Day to Labor Day).', '', 'Early Fridays (office closes at 3 p.m.).', '', 'Hybrid Schedule (Mondays and Fridays WFH)', '', 'The office is closed between Christmas and New Year.', '', 'Company-sponsored lunch at least 1x a month.', '', 'And much MORE!', '', '', 'Throtle is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to diversity and inclusion in the workplace. We prohibit discrimination and harassment of any kind based on race, color, sex, religion, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, genetic information, pregnancy, or any other protected characteristic as outlined by federal, state, or local laws.', '', 'Flexible work from home options available.']

job_description: ['Date Posted:', '2023-08-31', 'Country:', 'United States of America', 'Location:', 'CO505: 720 Irwin Ave, Schriever AFB 720 Irwin Avenue Schriever AFB, Schriever Air Force Base, CO, 80912 USA', 'Position Role Type:', 'Onsite', 'About Us', ':', 'At Raytheon, the foundation of everything we do is rooted in our values and a higher calling – to help our nation and allies defend freedoms and deter aggression. We bring the strength of more than 100 years of experience and renowned engineering expertise to meet the needs of today’s mission and stay ahead of tomorrow’s threat. Our team solves tough, meaningful problems that create a safer, more secure world.', 'Job Summary', ':', 'As a', 'Senior Software Engineer', ', you will be working DevOps as part of a multi-disciplinary Agile Scrum Team participating in the development of the Radar Test Contract (RTC) Open Systems Architecture Sensor Models (OSM).', 'You will also be part of a larger Raytheon Modeling & Simulation team within the Algorithm & Simulation Directorate, which provides, develops, and maintains high fidelity performance simulations, executes system performance analysis (including pre-flight prediction, post flight matching, and verification and validation), aids new business initiatives and develops & executes technology roadmaps.', 'This is an On-Site Role', 'Responsibilities to Anticipate', ':', 'You will work in an Agile Scrum environment supporting multiple teams in a DevOps capacity for the Algorithms and Simulation Department on-site at Schriever SFB, CO', 'You will work on the maintenance and configuration of Continuous Integration / Continuous Deployment (CI/CD), build tools, DevOps platform, and new / existing internal tools', 'You will maintain and enhance the internal testing framework', 'You will be responsible for tool configuration, troubleshooting, maintenance, and automation', 'You will help develop our containerization strategy and our migration into containers', 'Basic Qualification', ':', 'Typically requires a Bachelors’ Degree in Computer Science or a related STEM Degree', 'With the above degree, this position requires five (5) years or more of documented work and/or academic experience in the following areas:', 'Documented experience on a DevOps software team using Linux', 'Experience using configuration of build tools such as CMake, Ninja, and/or Apache Ant', 'Experience using DevOps platforms such as GitLab', 'Experience maintaining and configuring Continuous Integration / Continuous Deployment (CI/CD) pipelines', 'Experience using scripting languages such as Bash and Python', 'The ability to obtain and maintain a U.S. security clearance prior to the start date. U.S. citizenship is required as only U.S. citizens are eligible for a security clearance.', 'Preferred Qualifications', ':', 'Experience with building compiled languages such as C++ and Java', 'Experience using RESTful APIs, such as the GitLab API', 'Experience with YAML and JSON Data serialization / configuration formats', 'Code repo management using Git', 'Containerization tools such as Podman, Docker, Kubernetes, or OpenShift', 'Configuration of Linters', 'Tool configuration, troubleshooting, maintenance, and automation (i.e. GitLab, VS Code, Jira, and Fortify)', 'CompTIA Security+ certification', 'Experience working with SQL databases', 'Documentation generation and automation using LaTeX', 'What We Offer', ':', 'Whether you are just starting out on your career journey, or are an experienced professional, we offer a robust total rewards package including compensation, healthcare, wellness, retirement, work/life benefits, career development and recognition programs. Some of the superior benefits we offer include parental (including paternal) leave, flexible work schedules, achievement awards, educational assistance, and child/adult backup care.', 'Employee Referral Award Eligibility', ':', 'This requisition is eligible for an employee referral award. ALL eligibility requirements must be met to receive the referral award.', 'The salary range for this role is 75,000 USD - 161,000 USD; however, RTX considers several factors when extending an offer, including but not limited to, the role and associated responsibilities, a candidate’s work experience, location, education/training, and key skills. Hired applicants may be eligible for benefits, including but not limited to, medical, dental, vision, life insurance, short-term disability, long-term disability, 401(k) match, flexible spending accounts, flexible work schedules, employee assistance program, Employee Scholar Program, parental leave, paid time off, and holidays. Specific benefits are dependent upon the specific business unit as well as whether or not the position is covered by a collective-bargaining agreement. Hired applicants may be eligible for annual short-term and/or long-term incentive compensation programs depending on the level of the position and whether or not it is covered by a collective-bargaining agreement. Payments under these annual programs are not guaranteed and are dependent upon a variety of factors including, but not limited to, individual performance, business unit performance, and/or the company’s performance.', 'RTX is An Equal', 'Opportunity/Affirmative', 'Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or veteran status, age or any other federally protected class.', 'Privacy Policy and Terms:', 'Click on this link to read the Policy and Terms']

job_description: ['Job Description:', 'Support GAF’s continuous integration build environment and automated package migration processes by automating release and deployment management tasks through scripting and other technologies:', 'Implement the automated infra creation using Infra as a code (“IaC”) template-based approach', 'Create CI/CD pipelines for application deployment infrastructure provisioning and maintenance; and configure software builds and automated deployments to non-production and production environments', 'Improve the efficiency of the hand-offs between software migration, testing, and other software development life cycle (“SDLC”) tasks through reporting and oversight of the key performance indicators (“KPI”)s, and enforcement of policies', 'Adapt to new technologies and products and their deployment techniques; and participate in the improvement, documentation, communication, and enforcement of configuration engineering processes for software application', 'Build and package .NET websites, Windows services, webWCF services, and MuleSoft applications', 'Maintain the version control system (branching model and security)', 'Create and maintain build definitions scripts and the setup of work item areas and iterations (AzureDevOps); maintain access to all the environments including DEV, QA, UAT and production for code migration of custom software', 'Perform AzureDevOps administration; support and maintain version control and perform software branching activities for each release cycle; and administer and maintain build/release systems by designing, documenting, implementing, and maintaining scripts to enhance current build/release processes', 'Incorporate new development projects into existing build structures', 'Install and upgrade new software tools as needed and administer common engineering resources; and create and maintain tools and scripts to deploy and configure software products', 'Troubleshoot application configuration issues in lower test and production environments; and ensure packages have been installed properly; and Document deployment procedures and processes as appropriate for multiple technologies and platforms; assist the Release Engineering team to record and execute the software deployment requests for .Net, J2EE and other technologies; and report on the configuration status of development, test, and production environments.', 'Must have a Bachelors’ degree in Computer Science, Electronics Engineering or related field plus five (5) years of relevant experience.', 'Experience must include:', '3 years of experience with TFS;', '3 years of experience with AWS/Azure/Kubernetes/Terraform;', '4 years of experience with source control systems and in managing the configuration and security;', '4 years of experience with various branching/merging methodologies and release procedures; and', '4 years of experience with scripting, development best practices, MS Build and PowerShell for automated Build-Release processes.', 'May work from anywhere in the United States.', 'We believe our employees are our greatest resource. We offer competitive salary, benefits, 401k, and vacation packages for all full time permanent positions. We are proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and GAF, Standard Logistics, SGI, and Siplast are proud to be affirmative action employers. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity, or Veteran status. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know. If applying for positions in the U.S., must be eligible to work in the U.S. without need for employer sponsored visa (work permit).']

job_description: ['Company Overview', 'Here at UKG, our purpose is people™. Our HR, payroll, and workforce management solutions help organizations unlock happier outcomes for all. And our U Krewers, who build those solutions and support our business, are talented, collaborative, and innovative problem-solvers. We strive to create a culture of belonging and an employee experience that empowers our people – both at work and at home. Our benefits show that we care about the whole you, from adoption and surrogacy assistance to tuition reimbursement and wellness programs. Our employee resource groups provide a welcoming place to land, learn, and connect with those who share your passions and interests. What are you waiting for?', 'Description & Qualifications', 'Description', 'The UKG OneWeb product development teams are seeking a motivated and experienced DevOps Engineer with a background in building web applications, managing CI/CD deployment pipelines, automated testing, capacity planning, performance analysis, monitoring, alerting, chaos engineering and auto remediation. You will be working alongside team Developers and Business Analysts helping us make progress on our journey towards a CI/CD, Devops culture by:', '', '', 'Helping us understand how our services are behaving – including capturing metrics using code instrumentation techniques and creating dashboards to observe application health', 'Bring value to our customers by deploying services with incredible speed, consistency and availability.', 'Building and maintaining tools, solutions and microservices associated with deployment, ensuring that all meet our customer service standards and reduce errors', 'Working with the engineering team to actively troubleshoot any issues that arise during testing and production.', 'In support of our culture, we have adopted a hybrid working model of 3 days per week in the office and the rest of the week from home.', 'Testing our system integrity, implemented designs, application developments and other processes related to infrastructure, making improvements as needed', '', 'Primary/Essential Duties and Key Responsibilities:', '', '', 'Engage in and improve the lifecycle of services from conception to EOL, including: system design consulting, and capacity planning', 'Define and implement standards and best practices related to: Service delivery, metrics and the automation of operational tasks', 'Support services, product & engineering teams by providing common tooling and frameworks to deliver increased availability and improved incident response.', 'Improve system performance, application delivery and efficiency through automation, process refinement, postmortem reviews, and in-depth configuration analysis', 'Collaborate closely with engineering professionals within the organization to deliver reliable services', 'Identify and eliminate operational toil by treating operational challenges as a software engineering problem', 'Actively participate in incident response, including on-call responsibilities', 'Qualifications', 'Basic Qualifications:', '', '7+ years of experience in application troubleshooting.', '7+ years of experience with cloud computing platforms.', '7+ years of experience with observability fundamentals, including monitoring, alerting, and analytics.', '', 'Preferred Qualifications:', '', '7+ years of experience with DevOps principles and approaches.', '7+ years of experience with CI/CD fundamentals.', '7+ years of experience with configuration management and infrastructure orchestration (IaC).', 'General understanding of networking architecture and protocols.', 'Demonstrated knowledge of best practices in metric generation, log aggregation, time-series databases, and distributed tracing.', 'General understanding of version control technologies.', 'General understanding of software quality assurance and software testing.', 'Fluent usage of Kubernetes management tools.', 'General understanding of database internals and SQL.', 'Strong scripting skills (e.g., Bash, Python).', 'Familiarity with cloud-based applications and containerization technologies.', 'EEO Statement', 'Equal Opportunity Employer', 'Ultimate Kronos Group is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and is committed to maintaining a diverse and inclusive work environment. All qualified applicants will receive considerations for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, disability, marital status, familial status, sexual orientation, pregnancy, genetic information, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, ancestry, citizenship status, veteran status, and any other legally protected status under federal, state, or local anti-discrimination laws.']

job_description: ['Overview:', 'Wipro Limited (NYSE: WIT, BSE: 507685, NSE: WIPRO) is a leading technology services and consulting company focused on building innovative solutions that address clients’ most complex digital transformation needs. We leverage our holistic portfolio of capabilities in consulting, design, engineering, operations, and emerging technologies to help clients realize their boldest ambitions and build future-ready, sustainable businesses. A company recognized globally for its comprehensive portfolio of services, strong commitment to sustainability and good corporate citizenship, we have over 250,000 dedicated employees serving clients across 66 countries. We deliver on the promise of helping our customers, colleagues, and communities thrive in an ever-changing world.', '', 'A PROUD HISTORY OF OVER 75 YEARS', 'FY22 REVENUE 10.4 BN USD', 'WE’RE PRESENT IN 66 COUNTRIES', 'OVER 1,400 ACTIVE GLOBAL CLIENTS', 'Role – AWS Data Engineer', 'Location – Portland, OR ( Hybrid)', 'Position Summary/Job Description:', 'Design, implement, and manage cloud infrastructure using Infrastructure as Code (IAC) principles with Terraform and CloudFormation.', 'Utilize your in-depth knowledge of AWS services to architect, develop, and optimize scalable solutions that meet business requirements.', 'Develop and maintain Java Spring Boot applications, ensuring code quality, performance, and maintainability.', 'Build and maintain CI/CD pipelines to automate application deployment, testing, and monitoring using tools such as Jenkins, GitLab CI/CD, or AWS CodePipeline.', 'Monitor, troubleshoot, and optimize cloud-based applications and services for performance, availability, and security.', 'Collaborate with DevOps and security teams to implement and enhance security best practices, compliance, and data protection.', 'Participate in cross-functional team discussions, code reviews, and technical discussions to drive innovation and continuous improvement.', 'Encourage collaborative efforts and camaraderie with on-shore and off-shore team members.', '', 'Relevant engineering experience such as software development; critical reasoning skills; ability to communicate technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders; experience delivering quality engineering outcomes.', 'Familiarity with containerization using Docker and Experience with CI/CD pipelines, automated testing, and deployment automation tools (Jenkins, GitLab CI/CD, CodePipeline, etc.)', 'Strong problem-solving and communication skills and the ability to work effectively in cross-functional teams.', 'AWS certifications (such as AWS Certified DevOps Engineer or AWS Certified Solutions Architect) are a strong plus', 'Wipro is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer and makes all employment and', "employment-related decisions without regard to a person's race, sex, national origin,", 'ancestry, disability, sexual orientation, or any other status protected by applicable law..']

job_description: ['The DarkStar Group is seeking a DevOps Engineer with a TS/SCI + CI Poly clearance to join one of our top projects in Bethesda, MD. Below is an overview of the project, as well as information on our company, our benefits, and our $25,000 referral program.', 'THE PROJECT', "The DarkStar Group's team provides Analytic Software Development, Data Engineering, and Cloud Migration services, as well as interagency communication and data-sharing solutions, as part of an enterprise program that spans two major Intelligence Community customers. This project regularly has new openings for Software Engineers, Cloud Infrastructure Experts, DevOps Engineers, Data Engineers, SharePoint Developers and Administrators, ServiceNow Developers, and various other types of IT professionals.", 'Work on this program takes place in Herndon, McLean, and Bethesda (we cannot support remote work) and requires a TS/SCI + Polygraph clearance (acceptable to this customer).', 'THE ROLE', 'The DarkStar Group is seeking a DevOps Engineer to research, design, develop and/or modify software systems (e.g., custom, COTS, GOTS). The purpose of this contract, is to provide devops, applied technology investigations, operations and maintenance and infrastructure lifecycle support services across the ODNI’s enterprise. Our support in NOVA and Bethesda includes software engineering/development, O&M, technology investigations, customer advocacy, business process engineering, and system design. Invent your future and make a lasting impact at DarkStar!', 'Duties included but are not limited to:', 'Work with our development teams to design and implement high-availability, high-performance Continuous Integration (CI) and Continuous Delivery (CD) solutions', 'Provide training on the DevOps best practices and software deployment as required', 'Day to day involvement with DevOps migration/automation processes for build and deploy systems', 'Present ideas for system improvements.', 'Provide Tier 2 and 3 operational support for cloud provisioned computer, network and storage resources', 'Conduct impact analysis for software changes.', 'Work closely with business analysts, designers, and subject matter experts to understand functional requirements.', 'Support formal testing in controlled environment before code is promoted to production. Adheres to program configuration change control standards.', 'Understands the structure and functionality of the COTS applications (e.g., Oracle, SAP, and Momentum).', 'Deploy infrastructure on AWS using Ansible and AWS CDK and support a cloud development environment', 'Use scripting to create Pipeline scripts for CI/CD flows within Jenkins', 'Write Ansible playbooks (YAML) and AWS CDK (Python) to deploy software and servers', 'Assist the team with creating user stories and features for existing and upcoming work', 'Required Skills', 'Bachelor’s Degree in a Technical field (i.e. Information Technology, Information Systems, Computer Science)', '5-10 years of experience as a Linux and Windows System Administrator, DevOps Engineer, Software Engineer, Automation Engineer and/or Cloud Engineer', 'Experience coding in at least one popular Java/Ruby/JS/Python framework', 'Knowledge and experience with configuration/automation tools such as Ansible/Chef/Puppet', 'Web and Application server deployment experience (Apache HTTPD/Apache Tomcat and Spring/Django/Rails)', 'Experience utilizing AWS services such as IAM, CloudFormation, CloudWatch, Config, Lambda, KMS, EC2, RDS, and S3', 'Extensive experience with Git source code management system', 'Ability to break large tasks down into smaller, more manageable pieces', 'Experience working in Agile, SAFe, and Scrum environments', 'Desired Skills', 'Expertise with IdAM solutions that supports the integration of enterprise user directories such as LDAP and AD, and/or 3rd-party SSO provider for identity information and applications via standards-based tokens', 'Good understanding of Public Key Infrastructure (PKI) and familiarity with openssl', 'Familiarity with NIST 800-53 controls and how to implement security controls', 'AWS Cognito/OAuth 2.0/OpenID Connect experience', 'SonarQube administration and configuration experience', 'Elasticsearch cluster deployment and management experience', 'AWS VPC Networking experience with Subnets, Route Tables, nACLs, and Security Groups', 'Experience configuring and implementing multi-factor authentication solutions for applications', 'In-depth knowledge of validation by government information assurance and cyber security standards and practices through formal verification methods', 'DoD STIG experience', 'About The DarkStar Group', 'Our Company', "The DarkStar Group is a small business that solves BIG problems. We're one of the Inc. 5000 fastest-growing private companies in the US, and our engineers and scientists support the most critical national security missions in Virginia, Maryland, and elsewhere. Data Science, Software Engineering, Cloud/AWS Infrastructure, and Cyber/CNO are our core areas of expertise. We offer interesting and important work, job security, some of the best and most flexible benefits you'll find in the IC, and salaries so strong that they'll likely surprise you.", 'Our Benefits', 'The DarkStar Group offers exceptional compensation and benefits:', 'very strong salaries;', '100% company-paid medical, dental, and vision premiums for you and all dependents;', "the ability to get increased salary if you don't need medical/dental/vision;", '100% company-paid disability and life insurance benefits;', 'a generously-funded HSA;', 'an 8% 401(k) contribution;', '31 days of PTO/holidays to start (more with tenure);', 'the ability to flex time across pay periods without using your PTO;', 'a generous training budget;', '$25,000 employee referral bonuses;', 'business development / growth incentives; and', 'top notch company swag.', '** We have a huge growth opportunity, so we are offering up to a $25,000 reward for anyone new you refer whom we hire. **', 'All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.']

job_description: ['Work Mode:', 'Onsite', 'Responsibilities:', 'Tencent Overseas IT has the mission to empower Tencent’s rapid global growth with future-ready, global IT platforms, applications, and services. We are chartered to lead the Overseas IT strategy, architecture, roadmap, and execution. Satisfying our internal and external customers and becoming a world-class global IT team are our top aspirations.', '', 'We are currently looking for a passionate DevOps Engineer – Build & Release focused on leveraging technology in innovative ways to resolve challenging problems in IT Foundation Services. From Foundation Support to Infrastructure Build-out, from Day 1 Onboarding to ongoing Engagement, IT is always at the forefront, delivering the most important experiences to our internal and external customers every day. This position will report to IT Manager, Americas IT.', '', 'Working closely with our Overseas internal and external studios, HR, Finance, and various business teams, this role will be critical in designing, planning, building, and optimizing simple, sleek, cohesive IT blueprints, including the necessary solutions, platforms, applications, and processes. We believe this is a key component to enable Tencent’s rapid employee and business growth in the Overseas market, including the Americas, Europe, and APAC.', 'Primary Responsibilities', 'Communicate closely with studio customers, and gain insights into business pain points and scenarios, combined with the characteristics of the Overseas IT products and solutions, to help customers identify, collect, and resolve technical problems; to assist customers in the expansion, adjustment, and optimization of IT infrastructures.', 'Design automation integrated solutions spanning studio applications, data, and infrastructure which includes on-premises and multi-cloud platforms.', 'Drive efficiencies in infrastructure solutions such as VMware and Kubernetes technologies which support both on-premises and cloud-based solutions.', 'Build business cases for studio solutions demonstrating the total cost of ownership reduction as well as potential risk mitigation aspects. Consult customers on their adoption of technologies such as DevOps, Infrastructure, and Data Pipelines to create more integrated and valuable solutions.', 'Maintain awareness of new and emerging technologies that create strategic and tactical studio advantages.', 'Assist multiple concurrent complex IT projects, and establish collaboration ecologies with internal and external studio customers as directed by senior leadership.', 'Provide expertise and technical direction in functional areas to bridge business requirements and IT solutions. Engage with studios to architect transformative efforts leading to robust and efficient solutions for large studios.', 'Who we are looking for', 'Highly self-motivated, energetic, proactive, articulate, insatiable curious, and passionate about ideas and technology.', 'Decisive and results-oriented while maintaining a positive and optimistic attitude when encountering challenges.', 'Proven track record of delivering projects with a deep understanding of customer pain points, technology, quality, speed-to-market, and budget.', 'Extensive experience with Agile methodologies, from roadmap planning to delivery strategies.', 'Effective communication, coordination, organizational and interpersonal skills.', 'Excellent critical thinking, analytical and problem-solving skills.', 'Experience and success working with diverse global teams.', 'Requirements:', "Bachelor's degree in Computer Science.", '6+ years of working experience in the game development industry.', '4+ years of working experience in Build & Release pipelines, and distributed Windows/Linux-based services.', 'Excellent knowledge and expertise in Agile/Scrum project management methodologies, resource management practices, and change management techniques.', 'Able to work under pressure and find solutions to multiple and varying needs.', 'Bilingual in English and Chinese, and able to communicate in both languages with internal and external stakeholders, is a plus.', 'Location State(s)', 'California', '', 'The base pay range for this position in the state(s) above is $109,200 to $200,200 per year. Actual pay is based on market location and may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. A sign on payment, relocation package, and restricted stock units may be provided as part of the compensation package, as well as other medical, financial, and/or other benefits, dependent on the specific position offered.']

job_qualification: ['Management', 'Gradle', 'Software troubleshooting', 'Kubernetes', 'Ansible', '5 years', 'DevOps', 'Java', 'Microservices', 'AWS', 'PostgreSQL', 'Terraform', 'Redis', 'Splunk', 'DNS', 'Agile', 'S3', 'VMWare', 'Kafka', 'Maven', 'Jenkins', 'Strategic planning', 'ESXi']
job_description: ['Description', '', 'Ness is a full lifecycle digital engineering firm offering digital advisory through scaled engineering services. Combining our core competence in engineering with the latest in digital strategy and technology, we seamlessly manage Digital Transformation journeys from strategy through execution to help businesses thrive in the digital economy. As your tech partner, we help engineer your company’s future with cloud and data. For more information, visit www.ness.com', 'Ness is seeking an Technical Leader. This role will lead onboarding of all applications in risk renaissance pillar running on AWS Cloud to VMware on-premises failover environment . Customer is required by regulators to demonstrate the ability to run all risk systems through internal datacenter (“On-Prem”) and to be able to switch all production functionality running through On-Prem within the predefined SLA. The newly developed risk systems will act a business continuity operational system when cloud data centers are not available for any reasons. The current risk application run java microservices, Confluent Kafka-MRC event driven architecture, Redis cache, Cloudian-S3 data store, Flink data pipes and Enterprise PostgreSQL database. They have integration with IBM MQ, UC4 and Apigee to ensure seamless communication.', '', 'Responsibilities', ':', 'Lead the strategy and planning for onboarding and adopting existing AWS centric applications to VMware Environment.', 'Lead the data, code development, testing, networking, shared infrastructure. DevOps and release activities required to complete onboarding to VmWare infas from AWS.', 'Work in the DevOps team, to test the new shared infrastructure services for on premises failover environment including Confluent Kafka-MRC event driven architecture, Redis cache, Cloudian-S3 data store, Flink data pipes and Enterprise PostgreSQL database to ensure they are accessible and functional to be ready for onboarding.', 'Work with DevOps team to test the connectivity between new failover shared services and existing shared services: Secret, identity, LDA, DNS, Artifactory, Jenkins, Splunk services.', 'Deploy the risk application on RTOP using the newly developed continuous deployment pipeline on the RTOP shared infrastructure.', 'Lead team that makes necessary code changes to risk application to make sure they are compatible with RTOP VMware environment.', 'Lead the strategy for functional and integration testing effort to ensure the onboarded risk application are tested for functionality, integration and end-to-end process testing.', 'Collaboratively work with other teams in performing in failover, non-functional and operational testing for Risk applications', 'Understand the difference between developing the risk application on AWS and VMware environment. Then Ideate solutions to complex technical challenges in adopting applications to VMware Environment; code, test, troubleshoot, debug, and document the solutions you develop. Use agile software development model to produce well-designed programs, scripts, and tools required to provision, configure, and monitor new shared infrastructure services for on premises failover environment.', 'Continuously improve the processes and the DevOps team using thoughtful, calculated approaches to identify opportunities, and challenge those around you to strive for perfection.', 'Key Skills:', 'At least 15 years of strong technical leadership, strategy & planning skills', 'At least 10 years of leadership, stakeholder management and offshore management skills', 'Ability to lead and collaborate with Development, QA, DevOps, Infrastructure and Networking teams.', 'At least 15 years of experience in developing cloud native, microservices-event driven application on-premises (VMware environment and AWS Cloud) and ability adopt the application to both the environment.', 'At 6-7 years of experience building specializing in cloud/om-premise application modernization/movement/adoption using virtualization, DevOps pipelines, shared infrastructure deployments using terraform and data pipes.', 'About 5-6 years of experience in building Java streaming application using Flink, Kafka, Java Microservices, Redis Cache, and Enterprise Databases is good to have.', 'Deep understanding of performing data replication, failover, and DR strategies', 'Also 5-6 years of experience in collaborating with the functional, integration, non-functional (Performance, Security, Failover), and operational testing', '6-7 years of hands -on experience in Maven/Gradle using event driven architecture (Kafka)', 'Intermediate working knowledge of development tools like distributed message brokers like Kafka, and data streaming pipes using Flink.', 'Understanding of QA strategy and implementation', 'Experience in Kafka data replication between AWS and On-Prem', 'Experience with continuous deployment tools, techniques, and automation frameworks – especially Terraform Enterprise, Ansible, helm charts and deploying into Kubernetes (k8s)', 'Expertise with monitoring related tools and frameworks like Splunk, LogicMonitor, SignalFX, and Prometheus.', 'Worked on projects involving deployment and management of micro services, and hybrid cloud/on-prem infrastructure, VMware ESXI, VMware Cloud Automation Center, AWS, VMWare Cloud, DevOps tooling etc.', 'Ness is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, religion, national origin, disability, protected Veteran status, age, or any other characteristic protected by law.']

job_description: ['INTUITIVE®', 'is a nationally recognized Best Place to Work that provides solutions from design through production to sustainment by delivering targeted results. Our diverse portfolio of capabilities and extensive customer base allows our employees countless opportunities to pursue their passions and support our nation’s Warfighters. Join our team that encourages creativity, welcomes initiative, and seeks excellence. Start Building Your Future today!', 'As our Lead DevOps Automation Engineer, you will collaborate with product managers, development, and test teams to create solutions to complex problems in mission-critical areas. You will apply Agile and DevOps/DevSecOps practices to streamline product delivery and reliable operations of products. You will design, develop, code, test, debug, document and deploy custom applications. Furthermore, you will apply analytical, automation, and coding skills in all phases of the Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC). You will lead and build a culture of DevOps excellence and remain aware of cutting-edge DevOps-enabling technologies, tools, processes, and standards. Additionally, you will participate in strategy discussions with senior engineering leadership and align DevOps development activities with larger engineering goals. This position will also require you to champion the automation of security testing and compliance checks to ensure fast and secure software delivery. To thrive in this role, you must be able to work in a collaborative, dynamic work environment while managing multiple projects simultaneously. Time management and self-starting tasks will be critical to your success, as well as the success of our customers. Also, you will ensure compliance with relevant security standards, regulations, and industry best practices.', 'Required', 'BS in Computer Science, Engineering, or in a related field', 'Minimum 5 years of experience in delivering Software solutions', 'Collaborates with Software Engineering team to design solutions based on the software technologies, system requirements, and Software Development Lifecycle workflow', 'Familiarity with DevOps, continuous integration, and continuous delivery (CI/CD) concepts', 'Works with customer teams to ensure requirements and system integrations are well documented and designed with security, scalability, resiliency, and performance', 'Strong diagnostic skills and ability to research, troubleshoot, and determine solutions', 'Mentors DevOps team members, develops training plans and fosters a culture of knowledge sharing', 'Some travel', 'Must have an in-scope security clearance', 'Desired', 'Strong organizational, time-management, written and communications skills', 'Strong ability to grow contracts and new business opportunities', 'Experience with Container technologies such as Docker, Kubernetes, etc.', 'Experience using scripting languages such as Bash and Python', 'Experience leading and collaborating with developers and testers', 'Familiarity with utilizing Git/GitLab', 'Experience developing and operating CI/CD pipelines, Jenkins, ELK stacks, or related technologies.', 'Disability Accommodation for Applicants - Intuitive Research and Technology Corporation is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer and provides reasonable accommodation for qualified individuals with disabilities and disabled veterans in its job application procedures. If you have any difficulty using our online system and you need an accommodation due to a disability, you may use the following alternative email address or phone number to contact us about your interest in employment at', 'INTUITIVE', '', 'hr@irtc-hq.com', 'or 256-922-9300. job_description: ['Job Summary', 'This position may focus on all modes domestically for shipments outbound from our DCs throughout our customer network. goals and carrier management, ensuring partners meet or exceed our service expectations.', 'Primary Duties and Responsibilities', '· Responsible for measuring, analyzing, and reporting transportation services and routes (50%)', 'o Maintain carrier scorecards and operational metrics tracking critical KPI’s for enhanced service and quality in weekly, monthly meetings.', 'o Drive carrier compliance to ensure on time delivery and address shipment exceptions.', 'o Review and authorize carrier invoices for payment.', 'o Generate internal reporting for different functions of the business (weekly, monthly, quarterly).', 'o Provide customer service to internal and external customers.', 'o Support financial estimates for necessary functions of transportation.', 'o Assist team members and internal customers in analysis and tracking of information as needed.', 'o Any additional tasks as required by supervisor.', '· Drive savings and improve service levels (50%)', 'o Evaluate lanes and modes to for software, firmware, and mobile app teams.', '· (15%) Develop and maintain technical documentation, including knowledge base articles and best practices.', '· (5%) Serve as a support point of job_description: ['Requisition ID', '536221', 'Medidata: Power Smarter Treatments and Healthier People', '', "Medidata is leading the digital transformation of life sciences, creating hope for millions of patients. Medidata helps create the evidence and insights to help pharmaceutical, biotech, medical device and diagnostics companies, and academic researchers accelerate value, minimize risk, and improve outcomes. More than one million registered users across 1,900+ customers and partners access the world's most trusted platform for clinical development, commercial, and real-world data. Medidata, a Dassault Systèmes company, is headquartered in New York City and has offices around the world to meet the needs of its customers. Discover more at", 'www.medidata.com', 'and follow us', '@medidata', '.', '', 'Our Team:', '', 'You will help our engineering team expand and maintain a Randomization and Trial Supplies Management application ("RTSM"), allowing clients to randomize trial participants and manage trial inventory. This solution has been helping clients with their clinical trials for over 10 years.', '', "What we're looking for:", '', 'An engineer who is passionate about application deployment and monitoring, and who wants to stay current with new technologies and engineering concepts. Your primary responsibilities will include hands-on development of RTSM deployment pipelines, understanding pain points and creating and implementing solutions to address those pain points. We use Travis, GoCD, SumoLogic and AWS services like MSK, ECS and CloudWatch. Our goal is to achieve a fully automated, zero downtime blue/green deployment, and we need your help!', '', 'Design, build, test, document, deploy, monitor and maintain applications in a production environment. In addition to your primary responsibilities on RTSM, you will be providing leadership and guidance on DevOps and SRE practices across several products across the medidata clinical trials platform. We are looking for solutions that we can extend and standardize over our entire suite of products.', '', 'You will work with Agile team members, collaborating with developers, testers and with product managers to turn great ideas into detailed requirements. This is not a “throw it over the wall” environment: you will report to a manager who also manages application engineers.', '', 'Most team members are based in NYC out of our Soho office, but this position is also open to remote candidates.', '', 'Requirements (Education & Experience):', '', '', '10+ years experience working with cloud deployments (here, you will use AWS).', '', 'Experience with the following a plus:', 'Observability, monitoring and alerting experience', '', 'SumoLogic (or some other log aggregation tool) dashboards', '', 'Error tracking, continuous profiling and user monitoring', '', '', 'not defined', '', 'Equal Employment Opportunity', 'In order to provide equal employment and advancement opportunities to all individuals, employment decisions at Medidata are based on merit, qualifications and abilities. Medidata is committed to a policy of non-discrimination and equal opportunity for all employees and qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth or medical or common conditions related to pregnancy or childbirth), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, marital status, familial status, national origin, ancestry, age, disability, veteran status, military service, application for military service, genetic information, receipt of free medical care, or any other characteristic protected under applicable law. Medidata will make reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with known disabilities, in accordance with applicable law.']

job_description: ['', 'Computer Science degree or equivalent work experience.', '', '4+ years of professional experience of software development or in related occupations (systems administration, DevOps engineering, site reliability engineering, networking/automation, software/systems development).', '', 'Experience building scripts, tooling, and automation using modern programming languages, such as: Java, C/C++, C#, Objective C, Python, JavaScript, Ruby, Powershell, Typescript, or Go', '', 'Proven track record of success in delivering complex projects.', '', 'Demonstrable track record dealing well with ambiguity, prioritizing customer needs, and delivering measurable results in a fast-paced environment', '', 'Thorough networking knowledge including DHCP, Firewalls and ACL', '', 'Thorough Windows server knowledge including AD, Windows Clustering and Server Management.', '', 'Amazon Corporate Security’s (ACS) mission is to deliver a safe and secure workplace for all Amazonians. The Technology and Tools team within ACS develops, implements and maintains the technology and tools that enable other teams within Corporate Security. The Tech and Tools team is looking for an experienced Systems Engineer that can help deliver best-in-class physical security systems to our 1.7MM+ cardholder customer base.', 'As ACS’s scope continues to grow, the Tech and Tools team is seeking the technical expertise that will help build on the current infrastructure and drive development of new solutions that will exceed our customer’s expectations. As a member of the team overseeing one of the largest Physical Access Control Systems in the world, the successful candidate must be comfortable with not only troubleshooting but deep diving to create solutions for issues that no other company has yet faced or solved for.', 'Key job responsibilities', 'On a “typical” day engineers might deep dive to root cause of a customer issue, investigate why a metric is trending the wrong way, consult with the top engineers at Amazon, or discuss radical new approaches to automate operational issues.', '', 'The systems engineer can look forward to:', '', '', 'Investigating new ways to improve operations and defining new solutions to solve technically complex issues.', '', 'Work with the development team to automate manual tasks and on tooling to enhance fleet maintenance', '', 'Investigating issues that impact major services and work to solve them before they impact customers.', '', 'Diving deep into service interdependencies and region-specific configurations to find the root of a problem.', '', 'Studying and continuously learning from industry recognized engineers.', '', 'We are open to hiring candidates to work out of one of the following locations:', 'New York, NY, USA', '', '', 'AWS SysOps Certification', '', 'Cisco/Meraki certification(s)', '', 'Experience building highly-scalable, globally-distributed systems with a high degree of operational excellence', '', 'Clear, professional communication skills able to contribute to team discussions, knowing when to contribute, when to listen, and when to ask questions', '', 'Experience using AWS services', '', 'Experience developing new application and system management tools and making enhancements to existing tools to drive automation, reduce manual effort and increase efficiency.', '', 'Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us.', 'Our compensation reflects the cost of labor across several US geographic markets. The base pay for this position ranges from $83,600/year in our lowest geographic market up to $207,900/year in our highest geographic market. Pay is based on a number of factors including market location and may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. Amazon is a total compensation company. Dependent on the position offered, equity, sign-on payments, and other forms of compensation may be provided as part of a total compensation package, in addition to a full range of medical, financial, and/or other benefits. For more information, please visit https://www.aboutamazon.com/workplace/employee-benefits. Applicants should apply via our internal or external career site.']

job_description: ['Overall Job Summary', '', 'Team Lead, IT DevOps Engineering position is a leadership and management position responsible for developing and leading the Tractor Supply E-Commerce DevOps engineering team and associated DevOps practices. Environment/Infrastructure issues, Code/Data Sync, Sizing needs, architectural designs to internal teams and present design options/considerations for operational efficiency.', '', 'Provide day-to-day support of multiple environments, ensuring that these environments are properly setup, configured, and highly available for each team as scheduled.', '', 'Assist in tracking patches and fix packs regularly across products and environments and test and safely roll out to production.', '', 'Innovative DevOps solutions and solve technical problems and improve operational & cloud efficiencies job_description: ['Insulet started in 2000 with an idea and a mission to enable our customers to enjoy simplicity, freedom and healthier lives through the use of our Omnipod® product platform. In the last two decades we have improved the lives of hundreds of thousands of patients by using innovative technology that is wearable, waterproof, and lifestyle accommodating.', 'We are looking for highly motivated, performance driven individuals to be a part of our expanding team. We do this by hiring amazing people guided by shared values who exceed customer expectations. Our continued success depends on it!', 'Job Title: Senior Manager, DevOps, Test Automation Framework and Tools', 'Department: R&D Medical Devices', 'FLSA Status: Exempt', 'Insulet started in 2000 with an idea and a mission to enable our customers to enjoy simplicity, freedom and healthier lives through the use of our Omnipod® product platform. In the last two decades we have improved the lives of hundreds of thousands of patients by using innovative technology that is wearable, waterproof, and lifestyle accommodating.', 'We are looking for highly motivated, performance driven individuals to be a part of our expanding team. We do this by hiring amazing people guided by shared values who exceed customer expectations. Our continued success depends on it!', 'Position Overview:', 'The Senior Manager, DevOps, Test Automation Framework and Tools will be responsible for delivering critical strategic guidance and planning efforts to core DevOps, Test Automation Framework and Tools development capabilities. This role will drive the continuous integration of cross functional capabilities that will enable Insulet to establish a world class continuous integration and continuous delivery pipeline. This is a full-time exempt position reporting to the Sr Director, Mobile Applications.', 'Responsibilities', 'Identify opportunities of improvement in the end-to-end release process in Insulet and lead the DevOps, Test Automation Framework and Tools team in developing the tools and solutions to address them.', 'Develop and drive a clear vision and strategic roadmap of initiatives that improve the scalability, reliability, and efficiency of end-to-end release delivery and validation.', 'Identify, present, and implement strategies that address future needs for technology and lab expansion to ensure Insulet’s future product roadmap is supported.', 'Ensure that critical test automation and release management infrastructure meets the standards of operational excellence to support continuous validation and release processes.', 'Ensure the automation and integration requirements for internal customers are responded by the team in a timely and flexible manner.', 'Drive the DevOps, Test Automation Framework and Tools team to deliver capabilities to track and provide a platform to monitor metrics on the performance of Insulet’s continuous integration and delivery infrastructure.', 'Lead and manage a large team of engineers, providing mentorship, guidance, and professional development opportunities.', 'Foster a culture of innovation, collaboration, and continuous improvement within the team.', 'Manage and prioritize the budget, resources, and timelines to ensure successful team execution.', 'Drive the team to meet critical Quality, Regulatory, and Manufacturing requirements across all deliverables.', 'Collaborate closely with the cross functional SW Mobile Applications leadership on organizational-wide initiatives.', 'Education and Experience Requirements', 'Minimum Requirements', 'Requires a BS degree and 10-15 years of prior relevant experience or Masters with 8-10 years of prior relevant experience.', 'Demonstrated success in driving improvements in automation of continuous integration and continuous delivery of mobile solutions as a team leader.', 'Demonstrated ability to adapt to new technologies and grasp new concepts quickly.', 'Preferred Requirements', 'Experience collaborating and responding to multiple releases in a fast-paced environment with cross functional teams of 100+ developers and partners.', 'Strong verbal and written communication tools, able to communicate at multiple levels of an organization.', 'A passionate, inspirational leader who leads with an enterprise mindset, challenges the status quo, and can align their organization behind a clear vision and strategy.', 'Has strong emotional intelligence and ability to engage and lead others through change to advance new ways of working.', 'Experience building high performance teams, driving accountability, empowerment, customer centricity and collaboration across functions and teams.', 'Talent leader with demonstrated success attracting, growing, and developing talent.', 'Strong technical background in working with both android and iOS mobile platforms', 'Proven experience working with automation and test management tools such as JIRA, ALM, Confluence, and Helix.', 'Experience in MedTech, Fintech, or other regulated industry a plus', 'Additional Information', 'The position can be remote, hybrid or in-person at our San Diego, CA location.', 'Travel is estimated at 20% but will be flexible depending on business need.', 'Physical Requirements (if applicable):', 'It is expected that you can travel to Insulet’s San Diego (CA), Acton (MA) or Tijuana (MX) offices at least twice per quarter to support critical planning and executive coordination activities.', 'NOTE: This position is eligible for 100% remote working arrangements (may work from home/virtually 100%; may also work hybrid on-site/virtual as desired). #LI-remote', 'Additional Information:', 'The US base salary range for this full-time position is $157,360.00 - $223,750.00. Our salary ranges are determined by role, level, and location. The range displayed on each job posting reflects the minimum and maximum target for new hire salaries for the position in the primary work location in the US. Within the range, individual pay is determined by work location and additional factors, including job-related skills, experience, and relevant education or training. Your Talent Acquisition Specialist can share more about the specific salary range for your preferred location during the hiring process. Please note that the compensation details listed in US role postings reflect the base salary only, and do not include bonus, equity, or benefits.', 'At Insulet Corporation all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.', '(', 'Know Your Rights', ')']
